name: Dreadnought:  Fighter 24 / Bard 6 / Red Dragon Disciple 10
author: Demos

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
The original concept for this build came up as a conversation with Bulvine while playing on WoG. We were tossing ideas back and forth about RDD stereotypes and came up with this monster. I looked through the build engine and found 1 Fighter / Bard / RDD build that had both Dev Crit an EDR, Spooky222's Dragon Warrior (FTR 28/Bard 2/RDD 10). Most builds go for either more bard for casting or lots of raw strength. There were a few dual wielders and a couple of more "defensive" minded builds (defensive being a relative term - we are talking about FTR/RDD's here).

Compared to Spooky's build, the Dreadnought has 4 more bard levels to spread out the skill dumps, a much different leveling scheme and differences in feat selection. Also, with Spooky's setup, you can't use bard song until level 18 @ Bard 2 whereas you can here at level 7 with Bard 1.

Take a look. Comments, questions, suggestions and critiques are always welcome!

Notes:
1. You can go Human instead. You will gain 43 skill points and another feat but lose out on 1 AB because you now have to trade 2 STR bumps for CON.
2. Expertise is not critical to this build since base armor+shield is 36, but I like my AC and his AB is high enough where you probably won't notice a difference. On the human version, Improved Expertise is an option to further increase AC.
3. This build does not get any spells and I am not making any apologies for that. This is an out-and-out front liner Besides, with only 6 levels of Bard, and with level 6 coming at 40, the use of spells would not add much, if anything to this build.

Pros:
1. Strong offensive presence: Dev Crit with a 44 DC, 45 AB, STR of 38 = 14 extra points of damage, EWS = 6 extra points of damage, Taunt
2. Strong defensive presence: 36 AC for a plate wielder and 41 with Expertise, 600 HP, RDD immunities, EDR for 9 points

Cons:
1. Lack of skills (if built as-is)
2. Relatively weak saves. With no Evasion and a Reflex of only 21, expect to take full damage from most traps. +10 vs. Spells can be a life saver here and you get +1 to all saves with bard song activated at level 40)

When I played nwn, you couldnt use items to cast spells, meaning, you needed a MINIMUM of 11 in the casting stat to cast. Bard is a Charisma-based caster therefore, by my somewhat limited understanding (Maxi will correct me), this guy cant cast nor memorize bard spells, ever, and thus, is a typical fighter - melee rdd, with "defenseive" feats (of which, 24 fighter levels practically necessitates as you have so many extra feats to use).

Other than that, excellent work! The important thing is not the numbers or server but that you had an idea and built it! Oh so many since 2004 have simply asked for the build to be made for them. BRAVO!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: Right avado, no casting for him, but I don't think that was his intention at all. I think he just wanted more playability and skill dumps and earlier stuff. Worthy effort, although not at all my style of building. I generally sacrifice playability for more lvl 40 power, not making them unplayable, but relying on my in-game decision-making to get them by, and this guy goes the opposite way. I'd go for the 28/2/10 spread or Bard 26 FTR 4 RDD 10 or Bard 16 FTR 14 RDD 10, or Bard 20 FTR 10 RDD 10. LOL, this combo does give a lot of options!

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Demos, Note 3 wrote:3. This build does not get any spells and I am not making any apologies for that. This is an out-and-out front liner Besides, with only 6 levels of Bard, and with level 6 coming at 40, the use of spells would not add much, if anything to this build.
Yes, Max is right. I typically look for playability over pure level 40 power so he's right on that account also.

A 6th level bard can cast up to level 2 spells, so if you wanted to have that option, increase starting CHA to 10 (and get to 12 through the RDD) by dropping STR to 14. The end result is a STR of 36 and AB of 44 and you start casting at level 23 @ Bard 4. Since Bard isn't picked at level 1, you can start with any value of CHA. However, the the timing of when you get access to spells, their short duration and having to do the strip show each time really limits their usefulness.

posts.author: Firefly
posts.content:
I have a similar character F22 B8 RDD10. The spells are semi useful against pure fighter types who can't dispel you, but generally against anything who can the spells last 1 round. The Bard Song is more useful.
I think dropping some Bard levels would be better though. The gains from Bard 6 compared to Bard 2 in Bard Song are just 1 Reflex and Fort saves and an extra dam. Dropping 2 Bard pre epic gets an extra fighter level and you can take Luck of Heroes and regain the saves plus an extra will save. Dropping 2 in epic gets 2 great strengths and the extra dam plus an extra AB. Granted, you lose some skill dumps but it also means you can get some feats faster, particularly Dev Crit, which would also have a 45 instead of 44 DC.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
@Firefly
The additional bard dumps were a preference of the build as Demos stated up front:
Demos wrote: I typically look for playability over pure level 40 power so he's (i.e. Max) right on that account also.
Unless it is a server that is easy to level up, there is a significant benefit to regular skill dumps that likely out-weighs the added AB & DevCrit DC. Casting via items (w/o Still Spell) and the mini-song is only a minor by-product of the planned playability. Besides, the OP's build is a serious taunter. With d20 OnHeartbeat rolling, high Search has little value within most environments especially with +Search skill equipment that is quite common even on low magic servers.
